resources.string: The terminology section provides information regarding common terms used in android development
The websites section provides links to various websites with information useful for learning Android

string-array.name: Terms
string-array.item: adb,Command line tool allowing the communication with an emulator or android device
Emulator,A tool allowing for your computer to act as/emulate an Android device
Android,An operating system
Screenshot2,A tool allowing for screen capture of an emulator device
gradle,A tool for build autmation including testing and deploying
pm,The command to remove your application from your test device
lint,A debugging tool for optimizing your build
Project,A project is the top level of your work and contains all the code and data needed to develop and build your application similar to a workspace in Eclipse.
Panel,A panel is a screen that is displayed on your device.
Toolbar,A toolbar is the row at the top of the screen with various options to control the IDE
Preview Pane,The preview pane is the screen displaying the android device that allows for previewing of your screen without running the emulator.
Android Pane,The android pane displays Android DDMS information regarding the currently running emulators.
Project Explorer,The project explorer allows you to browse through the contents of your project folder.
.idea Folder,The .idea folder contains settings relevant to the project
intellisense,Intellisense is the tool built into the IDE allowing for prediction of code as you type.
Module,A module is a grouping of your code/data that can be built and run.
Live Layout,Live layout allows you to preview your application on a connected Android device.
init,Git init is used to create a new empty git directory.
commit,Git commit is used to save changes made on your local repository.
push,Git push is used to push commited changes to a remote repository.
add,Git add is used to add files to be tracked by git.
pull,Git pull is used to download remote repository files to your local repository.
branch,Git branch is used to duplicate a repository into another new branch.
clone,Git clone allows you to copy a repository into a new location/directory.
